title: Chord: 9th in F (Shape: D)
content:
# Chord: 9th in F (Shape: D)

The 9th chord in F with the shape of D is a colorful and harmonically rich chord that adds depth and complexity to musical compositions. It consists of the notes F, A, C, E, and G, creating a lush sound that can evoke various emotions depending on how it is used in a musical context.

## Notes and Intervals
- F (Root)
- A (Major 3rd)
- C (Perfect 5th)
- E (Major 7th)
- G (9th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The 9th chord in F with the shape of D is often used in jazz, R&B, funk, and soul music genres. It adds a jazzy and sophisticated flavor to a musical piece, creating a sense of tension and release. This chord is commonly used in chord progressions to add movement and harmonic interest.

## Songs
1. **"Don't Know Why" by Norah Jones** - This song features the 9th chord in F (Shape: D) in a smooth and soulful jazz-pop ballad.
  
2. **"Summertime" by George Gershwin** - In this jazz standard, the 9th chord in F (Shape: D) is used to create a dreamy and atmospheric mood.
  
3. **"I Will Always Love You" by Whitney Houston** - The iconic ballad uses the 9th chord in F (Shape: D) to add emotional depth and richness to the harmonic progression.
